title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
#### **This is Coody**


We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting,combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.

  

At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.


Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.


We’re a **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals**, representing more than **14 nationalities**.

**Coody is more of a** **platform than a traditional consultancy**. Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice, **explore our Employee Handbook** and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.

#### **Why Coody**


At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a lean and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no extravagant conferences. Instead we give you:

**Maximized Compensation.** Typically a +40% salary increase.

**Freedom & Flexibility**. No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.

**Employment Security.** Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.

**Shape the Future.** Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.

#### **What you’ll be doing**


As a **Senior Machine Learning Engineer** at Coody, you'll take on fullstack Machine Learning Assignments covering the full spectra from GenAI, developing and training models in production, and building cloud platforms where they can run. Each assignment is 6–24 months and will give you both broadness and deepness from various industries and companies. Often, we play a key role for the project, product and team we work in. You will dive into complex systems, ramping up fast, and delivering real impact from day one. Beyond coding and training models, you’ll influence product direction, and fostering a collaborative, high-trust team culture.

#### **Who you are**


We believe that you have about **4+ years of experience** and a proven track record of delivering real results within Machine Learning. If you’ve got the following, you’re probably a great fit:

* A track-record of building and training ML models in production
* Cloud experience (AWS, GCP, Azure, Docker, Kubernetes)
* Experience with commonly used data tools (e.g., Spark, Dask, PySpark, Apache Beam)
* Expertise in Python and modern ML/AI libraries (PyTorch/TensorFlow, Transformers, LangChain, LangGraph, Vertex AI)
* Strong understanding of ML infrastructure: deployment, monitoring, debugging, optimization
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar
* You must be based in Sweden with a Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)

#### 
**How to apply**


Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criteria? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly!

title: ERP System Manager (IFS) till internationell industrikoncern i Bohuslän
description:
#### **Lockas du av att ta ett helhetsansvar för en affärskritisk ERP-plattform och driva digital transformation i en internationell industrikoncern i tillväxt?**


Ehrenborg Search söker nu för kunds räkning efter en ERP System Manager med djup kompetens inom IFS Applications/IFS Cloud. Vi söker dig som vill leda, utveckla och framtidssäkra ett koncernövergripande ERP-ekosystem – och samtidigt vara en central del av en europeisk expansionsresa.


Som ERP System Manager kommer du att vara anställd av koncernbolaget som finns med produktion och huvudkontor i hjärtat av Bohuslän. Bolaget har verksamhet i flera europeiska länder, är lönsamt och har stabila ägare. Det finns en stark digitaliseringsagenda inom bolaget där ERP utgör en nyckel.

**Om rollen**
-------------


Som ERP System Manager kommer du att rapportera till CIO och arbeta i IT-organisationen i gränslandet mellan affär och teknik.


Ditt fokus blir att leda och utveckla koncernens ERP-plattform (IFS) och säkerställa att den effektivt stödjer verksamheten och bolagets strategiska mål. Rollen kombinerar hands-on förvaltning med strategiskt ansvar för vision, roadmap och utveckling.


Du fungerar som organisationens primära ERP-expert och trusted advisor och leder ett internationellt, tvärfunktionellt ERP-team med resurser i Sverige och Centraleuropa. Rollen innebär nära samarbete med såväl processägare inom hela värdekedjan samt leverantörer.

**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**
-------------------------------

* Ägarskap för ERP-plattformen (IFS): stabilitet, utveckling, uppgraderingar och långsiktig förvaltning.
* ERP-strategi & Roadmap: forma och driva en koncernövergripande plan som balanserar stabil drift, modernisering och verksamhetsnytta.
* Krav- och förändringsledning: fånga affärsbehov, prioritera förbättringar och säkerställa kvalitet genom hela livscykeln (design test go-live stabilisering).
* Process- och workflow-optimering: förbättra arbetssätt och datakvalitet i systemet över flera funktioner/bolag.
* Integrationer & ekosystem: utveckla och optimera gränssnitt mot andra system, legacy-miljöer och BI/rapporteringslösningar.
* Data governance & regelefterlevnad: ansvar för masterdata, datakvalitet, systemloggar, åtkomstkontroll och ERP-relaterad compliance.
* Leverantörs- och avtalsstyrning: driva externa partners, avtal, SLA:er och kostnadseffektiva leveranser.
* Stödja internationell expansion: etablera ERP i nya marknader när koncernen växer i Europa.

##### **Vi söker dig som har**

### **Teknisk kompetens**

* Djup erfarenhet av IFS Applications/IFS Cloud (moduler, konfiguration, anpassningar).
* Stark förståelse för ERP-arkitektur, integrationer och gränssnitt.
* God kunskap i datamodellering, masterdata och datakvalitet.
* Erfarenhet av processdesign och workflow-optimering i ERP-miljö.
* Förståelse för IT-säkerhet och regelefterlevnad kopplat till ERP.

### **Ledarskap & samarbete**

* Dokumenterad vana att leda och utveckla ERP-/IT-team i tvärfunktionella miljöer.
* Förmåga att coacha specialister, skapa struktur och driva engagemang.
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga mot både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter.
* Naturlig relationsbyggare som fungerar som en trygg rådgivare till verksamheten.

### **Projekt- och förändringsledning**

* Erfarenhet av ERP-implementeringar, uppgraderingar och förbättringsprojekt.
* Vana vid projektplanering, resursstyrning och riskhantering.
* Trivs i internationella koncerner och kan hantera förändring över flera länder/processområden.

### **Personliga egenskaper**

* Driven, utåtriktad och nyfiken och kommunikativ.
* God förmåga att växla mellan operativt och strategiskt arbete beroende på vad situationen kräver.
* Hög integritet och trygg beslutsfattare.
* Lösningsorienterad och proaktiv.
* Engagerad ledare som gillar att skapa ordning och långsiktig stabilitet i komplexa systemlandskap.
* Bekväm med att arbeta på engelska i vardagen.

### **Rollen erbjuder:**

* En senior nyckeltjänst i en lönsam industrikoncern med stark tillväxt- och digitaliseringsagenda.
* Stort inflyttande . genom din påverkan på bolagets ERP-strategi blir du en viktig kugge i bolagets modernisering av processer och arbetssätt.
* Internationell kontext och chans att bygga ERP-struktur i nya europeiska marknader.
* Möjlighet att verka i en entreprenöriell kultur med hög genomförandekraft och kort väg från idé till beslut.
* Marknadsmässiga villkor, förmånsbil och modern arbetsutrustning.


Plats: Västkusten/Bohuslän med hög närvaro på plats i uppstarten, därefter hybrid.


Affärsresor sporadiskt inom Europa när rollen kräver det.

title: Engagement Manager - Automotive
description:
Göteborg


Engagement Manager - Automotive



At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

**Your Role**  

We are looking for an engagement manager that will be responsible for end-to-end delivery of embedded software projects within the automotive domain. This role ensures seamless execution of projects in alignment with client expectations while managing cross-functional teams and stakeholders, while supporting business growth efforts. As Engagement Manager you will be accountable for client engagement and client satisfaction on a day-to-day basis including scope, time, budget, and quality.  

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*  

* Being responsible for building and strengthening client-facing relationships to drive long-term engagement. Act as the primary point of contact for client stakeholders. Manage client expectations, handle escalations, and ensure high customer satisfaction.
* Ensuring compliance with engagement delivery requirements (contracted scope, time, budget and quality), Addressing all client requests and concerns
* Managing the engagement strategy, Tracking and managing all engagement metrics, Providing regular reporting on engagement performance
* Continuously bring value-adding proposals to the customer by leveraging your experience in different delivery models and ways of working.
* Engaging and networking with our global Capgemini organisation to ensure the customer is aware of and has access to all our offerings.
* Managing complex delivery project setups Problem solving skills & Crisis management skills

  

**Your Profile**  

* Extensive experience from the Automotive Industry working with embedded SW, preferably in infotainment systems and Android Automotive applications
* Good understanding of financial management and reporting
* Proven track record in operational management and in project delivery - Background in managing outcome-based delivery projects to customer.
* High level understanding Automotive SW development process and methods.
* Excellent communication, stakeholder- and people management skills
* Project management certification is a plus

  

**What we believe you will enjoy about working here**  

* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.

  

**Application**  

As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.  

  

A valid work permit for Sweden is required.

title: Finance System specialist
description:
**Att jobba som Finance System specialist**


I rollen som Finance System specialist kommer du ingå i ett team som ansvarar för förvaltning och vidareutveckling av Skandias koncerngemensamma ekonomisystem och dess interna och externa rapportering. Du säkerställer att Workday och dess kring system utvecklas i samråd med verksamhetens behov inom ekonomi, redovisning, koncernkonsolidering och uppföljning i rapporter och analys. Du samarbetar med Skandias Finance organisation och användare för att optimera processer och funktionalitet i systemet Workday.


Ansvarsområdet för rollen innebär bland annat att:

* Förvalta och vidareutveckla av FIinance cloud-baserade ekonomisystem Workday (Core, Accounting Center, Prism) och Adaptive
* Vidareutveckla och effektivisera våra in- och utgående integrationer ifrån våra källsystem och ut emot våra datalager och dess analysverktyg
* Utveckla våra behov inom finansiell analys och rapportering
* Drift, felsökning, support och incidenthantering av vår tekniska plattform Workday Finance
* Kravinsamling och behovsanalys med verksamhetens Superusers
* Testning, dokumentation och användarstöd enligt Skandias agila utvecklingsprocess
* Delta i projekt kopplade till systemförändringar, integrationer och förbättringar

**För att lyckas i rollen**

* Flera års erfarenhet av systemförvaltning och utveckling av finanssystem, gärna med djup teknisk kompetens
* Van att arbeta med krav- och processutveckling enligt agila metoder
* God förståelse för finansiella regelverk inom finanssektorn
* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom ekonomi och/eller systemvetenskap
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift (grundkrav)
* Förmåga att kommunicera inom både IT-tekniska och verksamhetsnära områden
* Driven, målinriktad, initiativtagande och strukturerad person med god samarbetsförmåga gentemot interna och externa intressenter


Meriterande erfarenheter

* Erfarenhet från bank- och/eller försäkringssektorn.
* Erfarenhet av systemspecialistroll, exempelvis förvaltning eller implementering av ekonomisystem.
* Förmåga att översätta affärsbehov och processutveckling till effektiva systemlösningar.

**Vad händer nu?**


Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.


Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Lena Malm på mailadress: lena.malm@skandia.se

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**


I den här processen har vi följande steg;

* Intervju verksamhet
* Intervju Team
* Personlighets- och logisk test med efterföljande djupintervju
* Slutdiskussion
* Referenser
* Bakgrundskontroll

**Mer om Finance**


Inom Finance arbetar vi *framåt tillsammans* för att vara en affärsnära partner och skapa långsiktigt värde för Skandia. Totalt sett består vi av fem olika avdelningar med ungefär 120 medarbetare som alla sitter i Stockholm på Lindhagensgatan 86.


Våra avdelningar inom Finance är: Finance Transformation & Infomation , Accounting & Reporting, Aktuarie & Modellering, Inköp & Support samt Group Planning & Control.


Tillsammans strävar vi efter att skapa ett effektivt och värdeskapande Finance. Vi arbetar proaktivt för att säkerställa effektiva kärnprocesser genom att följa externa och interna krav. Vårt huvuduppdrag är att stödja koncernledningen med analyser och strategiska beslutsunderlag samt övriga verksamhetsområden inom koncernen. Vi stödjer även våra funktioner med finansiell analys och rapportering. Vårt gemensamma arbete ska hålla hög kvalitet och skapa värde för Skandia. Tillsammans optimerar vi financeområdet genom nya teknologier, arbetssätt och kompetenser. Detta åstadkommer vi genom gott ledarskap, samarbete och engagemang.

title: Verksamhetsutvecklare och Managementkonsult
description:
**Vill du driva förändring hos våra kunder inom digitalisering, projekt- och verksamhetsutveckling?**

  

På Knowit Insight, som är Knowits managementkonsultverksamhet, är vi 550 konsulter som varje dag hjälper organisationer att växa och lyckas i en snabbt föränderlig värld. Här i Göteborg sitter vi tillsammans med cirka 250 kollegor på Knowit, och ungefär 70 av oss tillhör Insight. Nu söker vi fler som vill vara med och forma framtidens organisationer tillsammans med oss.


Digital utveckling går idag snabbare än någonsin och organisationer behöver vara mer adaptiva, förändringsbenägna och kunddrivna. För oss handlar digitalisering om mer än teknik. Det handlar om människor, beteenden och förmågan att skapa verksamheter som fungerar bättre, både idag och imorgon.


Vi arbetar nära våra kunder för att förstå, leda och realisera förändring, från att förbättra befintliga arbetssätt till att genomföra transformationer som gör verklig skillnad.

**Vem vi söker**


Nu söker vi dig som vill vara med och vidareutveckla vårt erbjudande inom management consulting, verksamhetsutveckling och digitalisering på Knowit Insight Väst.


Du har:

* 2–10 års erfarenhet som konsult, projektledare, verksamhetsutvecklare, business analyst eller liknande
* Relevant högskoleutbildning
* Driv och förmåga att omsätta managementverktyg i praktiken
* Erfarenhet av kundnära arbete och ett intresse för att skapa affärsmöjligheter
* Du gillar att utmana nuläget, hitta nya sätt att skapa värde och anpassa lösningar så att de verkligen fungerar i kundens vardag.


Du kanske också har med dig kunskap inom exempelvis AI- eller automationsdriven verksamhetsutveckling, data governance, energibranschen, supply chain eller upphandling. Det ser vi som ett fint tillskott.

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**


Våra åtaganden sträcker sig över flera områden från förstudier till implementationer och uppföljningar. Ett urval av vad du kan komma att arbeta med hos oss är projektledning, digital transformation samt utveckling av processer och arbetssätt. Att vara konsult på Knowit Insight Väst innebär ett varierande arbete med stora möjligheter att påverka och du får tillgång till ett starkt nätverk inom Knowits breda organisation.


Hos oss träffar du kompetenta och engagerade kollegor, får spännande utmaningar och möjligheter till roliga uppdrag. Du har tillgång till vårt fina kontor centralt i Göteborg där vi har möjlighet att ses för såväl erfarenhetsutbyten och kompetensutveckling, som för trevligt socialt häng. Vi är en driven grupp som kombinerar yrkesstolthet och skicklighet med omtanke och energi. Hos oss stöttar, utmanar och inspirerar vi varandra.

**Ansökan**


Låter detta som en miljö där du vill växa? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Vi använder oss av löpande urval och ser gärna att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.


Anställningsform: Heltid. Vi tillämpar provanställning.


Utbildning: Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.


Du ska kunna uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.


Eventuella frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Mathilda Hult som du kan kontakta på telefonnummer 0702-198508 eller e-post mathilda.hult@knowit.se


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

**Om Knowit**


Knowits vision är att skapa ett hållbart och mänskligt samhälle genom digitalisering och innovation. Vi skiljer oss från andra konsultbolag genom en decentraliserad organisation och vårt agila arbetssätt i kunduppdrag. Verksamheten är indelad i fyra affärsområden, Solutions, Experience, Connectivity och Insight som erbjuder tjänster inom skräddarsydd systemutveckling, digitala kundupplevelser, internet of things, cloud, cybersäkerhet och managementkonsulting.


Knowit grundades 1990 och har cirka 4 000 medarbetare, huvudsakligen i Norden, men även i Tyskland och Polen. Knowit AB (publ) börsnoterades 1997, och finns i dag på NASDAQ OMX Stockholm Mid Cap.

title: Solutions Engineer (Infrastructure)
description:
**Job Requisition ID #**
 25WD92668
   

  

**Position Overview**
 We are a team of solution engineers within our Named Accounts sales organization, supporting the entire EMEA region. We get to work with some of our most innovative and dynamic customers, helping them identify new ways to solve their business problems using our technology.
   

  

 Our team is growing, with leaders who are committed to supporting growth and development so we can be our very best. We like to think of ourselves as “technical domain experts” because we have the capacity, flexibility, and permission to challenge the status quo, fail fast, and try new things, all in support of growing our customers’ use of our technology.
   

  

**Responsabilities**
 In this role, you’ll get to showcase your industry and software workflows expertise by partnering with customers. You’ll ask questions, show empathy, and speak their language, taking their problems and translating them into solutions that meet their needs (which equals growth for us!).
   

  

* Collaborate with everyone across the Named Accounts sales and account teams, from account executives, technical solutions executives, and enterprise account sales executives to customer success managers, consulting, and technical account specialists
* Work directly with customers, from site operatives all the way to the C-suite, via workshops, scoping pilots, on-site visits, and more
* Propose ways to improve or solve customer problems, connecting the solutions to customer needs and highlighting the value provided
* Support strategic engagements within Autodesk to promote and grow our relationships
* Be part of a team that loves learning and tackling problems together
* Have a growth mindset, and bring your own experiences and ideas to the table to build on our shared success


**Minimum Qualifications**
* Experience influencing and shaping the delivery of projects and/or contracts in the infrastructure design and construction sectors (specifically transportation – road, rail, airport, and water distribution)
* Hands-on knowledge of Autodesk solutions and workflows in the infrastructure industry
* A solution-focused approach to solving problems
* A technical mindset, curiosity and capacity to learn new technologies
* Fluent in Business English
* Ability to travel up to 30% within the EMEA region, some global travel


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Additional languages per location
* Hands-on technical knowledge of competitive solutions (eg. Bentley)
* Understanding of platform technologies such as (but not limited to) APIs, Plugin development, visual scripting and AI workflows applied to the infrastructure industry
* Effective communication, presentation, and group facilitation skills
* Experience or interest in sales-supporting function (e.g., presales)
* Desire to manage influence through persuasion, negotiation, and consensus-building
* Network builder, someone who is comfortable in building meaningful relationships
* Works without supervision and can manage multiple priorities
* Knowledge of social media to strengthen industry profile and drive awareness with customers


****Learn More****
**About Autodesk**
 Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.
   

  

 We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – it’s at the core of everything we do. Our culture guides the way we work and treat each other, informs how we connect with customers and partners, and defines how we show up in the world.
   

  

 When you’re an Autodesker, you can do meaningful work that helps build a better world designed and made for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!
   

  

**Salary transparency**
 Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, our compensation package may include annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.
   

  

**Sales Careers**
 Working in sales at Autodesk allows you to build meaningful relationships with customers while growing your career. Join us and help make a better, more sustainable world. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/careers/sales
   

  

**Diversity & Belonging**
 We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging
   

  

**Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk?**
 Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site).

title: Fullstack
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* 6+ year of experience programming using Javascript.
* Extensive experience using Node.js, Typescript and React.
* Documented experience working in a AWS environment.
* Experience working with payments is a big plus
* Previous experience working in a transaction intensive project is a big plus.
* Knowledge of DevOps Is a plus but not a must have
* Previous experience of PHP is a plus but not a must have


**Application deadline:** 
 19-12-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Implementation Engineer
description:
Intric is accelerating its growth, driven by a fresh round of funding from investors and strong demand from both existing and new customers.
   

  

 Our platform - Intric.ai - is currently transforming how work is done, primarily within the public sector and companies that value data sovereignty, by making the power of AI accessible to a wider audience. We have secured a market-leading position in a niche of this segment.
   

  

 We are seeking a motivated individual eager to embark on the journey of a lifetime with our expanding and driven team.
   

  

**Your role**
 As an Implementation Engineer, you will working forward deployed with our customers. We believe that for us to be truly successful, and for our customers to get the true value of AI, we need to integrate our platform deep into our customers existing infrastructure. This is where you come in.
   

  

 You will work directly with customers to understand their technical requirements, deploy our platform, and build custom integrations that ensure our AI capabilities become an integral part of their day to day.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* You have 2+ years of experience in technical implementation, solutions engineering, or similar customer-facing technical roles
* You possess strong technical skills with experience in enterprise infrastructure, APIs, and integration patterns
* You're a problem solver who thrives on tackling complex technical challenges
* You have excellent communication skills in English, with additional European languages being a strong plus
* You're passionate about AI and its practical applications in solving real business problems
* You're willing to travel in order to fulfill your responsibilities


**Key Responsibilities**
 You will be instrumental in ensuring our customers successfully deploy and adopt our platform. Your work will directly impact customer satisfaction and our ability to embed our solution. This includes:
   

  

* Be a part of the sales process, providing technical support to prospective customers
* Deploy and integrate our platform in customer environments, working with their existing systems and infrastructure
* Build custom integrations and solutions tailored to specific customer needs
* Provide technical support to customers throughout the implementation process
* Collaborate with the product team to improve our platform based on real-world deployment experience


**What We Offer**
* An opportunity to be a part of building a system and company that defines the future
* Rapid career development in an exciting, fast-moving sector
* Competitive compensation package combining salary and stock options

title: AWS Public Sector Associate Cloud Architect
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS. As trusted advisors to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirement**
* This role requires you to be a Swedish National and have business level proficiency in the Swedish language


 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


 A day in the life
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 1+ years of experience in cloud architecture and implementation and 1+ years of experience in consulting and working with customers
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* Experience with one of the following programming languages/technologies: Java, Python, Ruby, Node.js, C, or C++
* and experience or proficiency in DevOps, Cloud Infrastructure, AI, Security, Software Development or Databases would be highly desirable


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with one of the following programming languages/technologies: Java, Python, Ruby, Node.js, C, or C++ and experience with source control repositories (e.g. GitHub/GitLab, SVN, Mercurial, and Perforce)
* AWS experience preferred, with proficiency in a wide range of AWS services (e.g., EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, IAM, VPC, CloudFormation)
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A3118390

title: Account Executive, Enterprise (Sweden)
description:
We’re in an unbelievably exciting area of tech and are fundamentally reshaping the data storage industry. Here, you lead with innovative thinking, grow along with us, and join the smartest team in the industry.
   

  

 This type of work—work that changes the world—is what the tech industry was founded on. So, if you're ready to seize the endless opportunities and leave your mark, come join us.
   

  

**The Role**
 We are seeking an experienced, consultative
 **Account Executive** 
 to drive meaningful new business growth and define sales strategy across our most strategic
 **Enterprise** 
 accounts in Sweden. This role focuses on evolving client relationships from transactional to value-led, advocacy-based selling, requiring strong discipline and strategic vision. You will apply deep industry expertise to champion innovative, transformational solutions, foster long-term partnerships, and maximize business and revenue impact. If you’re excited about the role but don’t meet every single requirement, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Drive business growth by strategically leading complex enterprise sales cycles with multi-regional stakeholders, consistently meeting or exceeding goals.
* Serve as a subject matter expert; set strategic standards for solution and consultative selling that shape how the segment uncovers business needs and co-creates solutions.
* Establish and sustain executive sponsorship by building trusted C-suite relationships that lead to transformational, long-term partnerships.
* Develop and lead strategic account management and expansion strategies (cross-sell/upsell/new logos) for the largest, high-potential customers.
* Define and uphold standards for operational excellence across the region/segment, proactively aligning and leading collaboration across internal teams and key external partners, including Global System Integrators (GSIs).


**What You’ll Bring**
* Extensive success in senior technology sales within enterprise accounts, with a consistent record of high performance.
* Mastery of strategic account management, demonstrated through the execution of complex, multi-year strategies that deliver measurable client outcomes and transformation.
* Deep, current understanding of the storage industry, cloud computing, and modern data center architecture, enabling credible thought leadership.
* Proven ability to acquire new enterprise logos, drive large-scale account expansion, and structure complex deals in partnership with the broader ecosystem.
* Ability to lead with market-shaping insights and build compelling, quantifiable business cases for C-level buy-in (ROI, TCO).
* Demonstrated strategic mindset and autonomy, with a track record of driving new technology adoption by defining and executing effective personal sales methodologies.
* High level of motivation and intrinsic drive, including emotional intelligence, a desire to mentor, and accountability for delivering results.
* Business proficiency in English and Swedish, depending on territory needs.


**What You Can Expect From Us**
* Pure Innovation: We celebrate those who think critically, like a challenge and aspire to be trailblazers.
* Pure Growth: We give you the space and support to grow along with us and to contribute to something meaningful. We have been Named Fortune's Best Large Workplaces in the Bay Area™, Fortune's Best Workplaces for Millennials™ and certified as a Great Place to Work®!
* Pure Team: We build each other up and set aside ego for the greater good.


 And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources and company-sponsored team events. Check out purebenefits.com for more information.
   

  

**Accommodations And Accessibility**
 Candidates with disabilities may request accommodations for all aspects of our hiring process. For more on this, contact us at TA-Ops@purestorage.com if you’re invited to an interview.
   

  

**Our Commitment To a Strong And Inclusive Team**
 We’re forging a future where everyone finds their rightful place and where every voice matters. Where uniqueness isn’t just accepted but embraced. That’s why we are committed to fostering the growth and development of every person, cultivating a sense of community through our Employee Resource Groups and advocating for inclusive leadership.
   

  

 Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire.
   

  

**JOIN US AND BRING YOUR BEST.**
**BRING YOUR BOLD.**
**BRING YOUR FLASH.**

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.** 




  





 As a Senior Software Engineer in the Customer Platform team, you’ll own and evolve the systems that define how users interact with Epidemic Sound — including account management and entitlements across both individual creators and enterprise customers. We’re the system of record for account structures and what users are entitled to, ensuring the right experience reaches the right person, whether it's a solo artist or a global creative team.
 



 This foundational work enables us to deliver flexible, scalable experiences and underpins many of our commercial and product initiatives. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to a high-impact platform with visibility across the organization — shaping how we deliver enterprise-quality features and scale our offerings.
 



 We also foster a strong engineering culture grounded in openness and collaboration. You will regularly engage in pair and mob programming, as well as dedicated hack weeks for experimentation and learning. If you enjoy knowledge sharing and shaping a team’s direction in a fast-moving environment, you’ll feel right at home here.
 



  





**Your key responsibilities include:** 



* Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services primarily in Golang on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Champion technical excellence from system design and architecture through development, deployment, reliability, and security.
* Collaborate closely with frontend developers to deliver seamless React/Next.js-based interfaces for managing accounts.
* Partner closely with enterprise, commercial, and product teams to define requirements, prioritize features, and shape the product roadmap.
* Clearly communicate technical plans, challenges, and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.



  





**Our Tech stack:** 




 We’re evolving our platform toward modern backend technologies, primarily using:
 


* Golang (our core backend language)
* Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Kubernetes and Docker
* GitHub and GitHub Actions for version control and CI/CD
* Grafana for monitoring and observability
* Event-driven architecture, microservices, and React/Next.js for frontend interfaces



  





**Requirements** 



* 5+ years of experience building and maintaining backend systems
* Proven experience in at least one backend language, such as Java, Node.js, Kotlin or Go, which demonstrates your ability to build and maintain mission-critical systems
* Strong grasp of distributed systems and system design principles
* Experience operating in cloud environments (GCP preferred, AWS also welcome)
* Experience working with modern CI/CD pipelines
* Willingness to work with Golang as we evolve in that direction
* Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate cross-functionally



  





**Soft Requirements** 




 You’re curious, proactive, and thoughtful. You enjoy solving real-world problems at scale and take pride in delivering reliable software. You’re someone who thrives in a dynamic environment, embraces uncertainty, and sees change as an opportunity to learn and adapt. You’re someone who:
 


* Navigates change with ease
* Shares knowledge generously
* Works collaboratively and transparently
* Thinks long-term while executing short-term



  





**Equal opportunity employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





**Application** 




 Ready to make the world
 *feel* 
 your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “interested” below. Please note this role is full time based in Stockholm.
 



  





***Thinking about joining us? Tune in here - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.***

title: Senior Backend Developer (Node.js)
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue, supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're looking for a Senior Backend Developer, who'll be a core member of our Card Services team, owning the systems that define the Qred VISA experience. Our mission is: solve complex cashflow problems for entrepreneurs, driving activation, retention, and massive transaction volume.
   

  

 Your work focuses on building highly resilient backend systems and scaling our product for new markets. You will drive key technical initiatives; from real-time payment features to personalized, data-driven loyalty programs. If you want high-impact ownership in a fast-moving, mission-critical domain, this is it.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Teamwork and collaboration: Work closely with the team’s developers, Tech Lead and Product Manager to find the best solutions and ensure we meet our goals.
* Test your own code: Take responsibility for the quality of your work by creating and running tests to ensure stability and functionality.
* Drive innovation: With a DevOps mindset, improve our workflows and contribute to the optimization of operations and delivery.
* Promote security and performance: Ensure our systems are secure and perform at their best, even as our user base grows rapidly.


**Requirements**
* Experience: Several years of experience in backend development with Node.js, and familiarity with modern workflows such as DevOps and Continuous Delivery.
* Relevant backend skills: A strong understanding of RESTful APIs and micro-service architecture.
* Cloud expertise: Experience working with cloud platforms. We use AWS, but its fine to have relevant knowledge from other cloud environments as well.
* Testing skills: Being comfortable writing and executing tests for your own code.
* Communicative and team-oriented mindset: You like working within a team, enjoy sharing knowledge and contribute to building a strong team spirit.
* Technical curiosity: You enjoy staying up to date on new technologies and tools in backend development.
* Language skills: Being comfortable using English as your working language and understanding the importance of clear communication in an international environment.


**We highly value**
* Cards and payments experience: If you have previously worked with credit cards, payments or transactions it’d be really valuable to us.


**Why join us?**
 This is the place to be if you’re looking for a place to grow. Qred is growing fast, and our Qredsters along with it. With a non-bureaucratic organization and delegated responsibilities, we make sure there’s a short path from idea to action. In addition to our great culture, you get to work with the latest cutting-edge techniques, responsibility for the whole development chain, and last but not least a bunch of great competent colleagues to learn from!
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in our headquarters in Stockholm. While we encourage a hybrid setup, we do expect you to be at least three days per week at the office. We review applications on a rolling basis and while the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Open Source utvecklare inom integration
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är omkring 320 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på åtta kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping, Köpenhamn, Århus. Oslo och Trondheim.*
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Vi har mer än 10 års erfarenhet från integrationsområdet och är idag stora partners till organisationer som exempel WSO2 och RedHat. Vi har länge haft ett brinnande intresse för Open Source och nu söker vi vassa utvecklare med fokus på integrationslösningar.
   

  

 Är du en utvecklare som vill nischa dig mot integrationer? Har du alltid haft ett extra gott öga för Open Source? Kittlar det till lite i magen när du får sätta upp containerlösningar? Då kan detta vara rollen för dig.
   

  

 Vi har flera utbildade och certifierade konsulter i området och nu förstärker vi vårt team ytterligare. Vi söker dig som, liksom vi, brinner för att leverera lösningar som bygger på öppen källkod. Till denna tjänst söker vi både dig med lång erfarenhet av integration och dig som är ny men nyfiken på området.
   

  

**I det dagliga arbetet kommer du att:**
* Jobba med teknologier som REST, GraphQL, Kafka, Apache Camel, Kubernetes, MQTT, RAML och OpenAPI
* Implementera integrationsflöden med Open Source plattformar
* Utveckla dina kunskaper inom microservices, CI/CD, containerlösningar och molntjänster.
* Stötta kunder med utvecklingen av deras integrationsplattform och löpande säkerställa prestanda och tillgänglighet på applikationslösningarna


**Vi ser gärna att du har:**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning i datateknik eller relaterat område
* Minimum 8 års erfarenhet av API-baserade integrationer och datatransformering
* Kunskap i Java eller andra Open Source relaterade verktyg
* Van att arbeta i agila team, gärna i en DevOps-setting
* Mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska


**Meriter:**
* Erfarenhet och/eller certifiering i någon integrationsplattform
* Erfarenhet av att kommunicera direkt med verksamhetsansvariga beställare och kunder
* Erfarenhet inom cloud, säkerhet, IAM och mikrotjänstearkitektur


**Varför Redpill Linpro?**
* Du får arbeta med några av de allra mest begåvade IT-talangerna i en organisation som brinner för professionella Open Source-ideal
* Vara en del av en kultur där man varje vecka har nya interna tech talks
* Trevliga chefer som för en bra personalpolitik och som verkligen lyssnar utvecklarna
* Du får ta del av fördelarna att arbeta på ett medelstort nordiskt bolag med go sammanhållning, bra förmåner och där du ges stor frihet och flexibilitet i ditt arbete


 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du vill arbeta med oss. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in seven offices with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: KAFKA ENGINEER TILL BANKGIROT
description:
*Vill du bygga Sveriges nästa generations betalningsinfrastruktur? Bankgirot växer och söker nu ytterligare en Kafka Engineer till vårt team i Stockholm.*
*Sveriges betalmarknad genomgår sin största förändring i modern tid – och Bankgirot spelar en central roll i att säkerställa att landets betalningar fungerar varje dag, samtidigt som vi bygger framtidens realtidsplattformar. Nu stärker vi vår kompetens inom eventdriven arkitektur och behöver dig som vill bidra till att etablera en robust, säker och skalbar plattform för datadrivna tjänster.*
 Din roll
   

  

 I den här rollen blir du en central del av Bankgirots arbete med att bygga och förvalta en modern, eventdriven plattform som ska bära Sveriges framtida betalningslösningar. Du får ett brett ansvar där du arbetar både strategiskt och operativt för att säkerställa att vår Kafka-miljö är driftsäker, skalbar och redo för de höga krav som ställs på realtidsdata i en affärskritisk verksamhet. Du är delaktig i hela kedjan – från design och installation till drift, övervakning och förbättringsarbete – och samarbetar nära utvecklingsteam, säkerhetsfunktioner och plattformsroller för att stödja våra integrations- och datadrivna initiativ. Dina huvudsakliga fokusområden är:
   

  

* Bygga och drifta Kafka-plattformen – du etablerar, konfigurerar och vidareutvecklar klustren på vår containerplattform, inklusive arkitektur, replikering, topics, schemahantering, Kafka Connect och Schema Registry.
* Säkerhet och stabil drift – du hanterar autentisering, accesskontroller och åtkomststyrning samt arbetar med felsökning, incidenthantering och processer för att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet.
* Automatisering och CI/CD – du skapar en effektiv och förutsägbar driftsmiljö med GitLab, Helm, ArgoCD och Infrastructure as Code-verktyg som Terraform och Ansible.
* Monitoring och optimering – du bygger övervakning och logghantering med Prometheus, Grafana och Elastic, och arbetar med kapacitet, prestanda, belastningstester och kontinuerliga förbättringar.


 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har en gedigen teknisk bakgrund och ett stort intresse för distribuerade system, dataflöden och plattformsutveckling. Du har arbetat med Apache Kafka i produktion och har en god förståelse för hur ett kluster ska designas, drivas och optimeras, inklusive hantering av topics, replikering, consumer groups och komponenter som Kafka Connect, Schema Registry och gärna även CDC-lösningar. Du har även erfarenhet av containerplattformar som Kubernetes eller OpenShift och vet hur man bygger en stabil, säker och skalbar driftmiljö där både utvecklingsteam och affärskritiska system kan förlita sig på plattformen.
   

  

 Vidare arbetar du bekvämt med automatisering och CI/CD och har vanan att hantera konfigurationer och deploymentflöden genom verktyg som exempelvis GitLab, Helm, ArgoCD, Terraform eller Ansible. Du har också god förståelse för säkerhet i distribuerade miljöer, där autentisering, accesskontroller, loggning och observability är naturliga inslag i ditt arbetssätt. Erfarenhet av övervakning och prestandaanalys genom verktyg som Prometheus, Grafana eller Elastic ser vi som en självklar del av din kompetens.
   

  

 Om du dessutom har arbetat med eventdriven arkitektur i större skala, har erfarenhet av molnbaserade Kafka-tjänster såsom Confluent Cloud eller AWS MSK, eller har verkat i en reglerad miljö inom exempelvis bank eller försäkring, är det meriterande. Framför allt söker vi en person som är nyfiken, ansvarstagande, kvalitetsmedveten och som trivs i en miljö där teknikens tillförlitlighet är helt avgörande.
   

  

 Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmåner
   

  

 Som vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter.
   

  

 Vi satsar mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

 Intresserad?
   

  

 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Nexer Recruit.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar? Kontakta gärna rekryteringskonsult Johanna Värmfors: johanna.varmfors@nexergroup.com eller +46 730 821 230 alternativt Artan Bitiqi: artan.bitiqi@nexergroup.com eller +46 723 61 28 44.
   

  

 Läs om fler lediga tjänster från Bankgirot här.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Om Bankgirot
   

  

 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar.
   

  

 Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar.
   

  

 Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Embedded Software Application Engineer
description:
**Professional Galaxy** is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise within IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.


Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.


Apply today, selection and interviews are ongoing.

 **Assignment Description**


We are looking for **Embedded Software Application Engineer** for one of our customers.


Perform functional development meaning requirement breakdown, software design, documentation, implementation, testing and verification.


Specialize in a technical domain (Vehicle, HMI, Combustion, Engine After treatment, Electro mobility, Powertrain control, Control Theory, Mechatronic, Diagnostics) in which features are developed.


Lead system engineering in a technical team and play an active role in the delivery. Integrate deliveries from others.


Responsibility for securing quality and readiness before release.


The deliveries are often focused on the early phases of the development cycle, developing technical roadmaps.


Network across the organization, as well as influencing the work in the other sites.


Develop acquired competence, as well as participate in the business development.


On Expert level the employee is a recognized expert in Embedded Software Applications typically obtained through advanced education and work experience (position typically requires 10 years or more relevant experience)

* Experienced project lead and an established coach, mentor and educator to others in VG
* Known subject matter expert and a natural goto person for complex discipline related issues
* Strong Tshaped profile (either building deeper discipline excellence or developing mature generalist toolbox)
* Known product owner, often contributing to project roadmaps/strategies within context of industry trends
* Clear articulation of value creation by joining up the dots between their work and the TD/BA strategy.

 **Duration**: 2025-12-15 to 2026-06-30

**Location**: Göteborg

**Application Deadline:** 2025-12-14


Please apply directly through our system with:

* Your updated CV
* Availability to start the assignment


In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.

**Please note:** We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.

**Offer continuously:** Please note that for this role we offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested, we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Performance & Calibration Engineer
description:
**Professional Galaxy** is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise within IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.


Are you the right person for the assignment, or do you want to recommend a strong candidate? Do not hesitate to contact us.


Apply today, selection and interviews are ongoing.

 **Assignment Description**


We are looking for a talented and experienced **Engine Development Engineer** to join our team.  

We believe that you have a genuine interest of working with testing and optimization of internal combustion engines and we expect that you have both the knowledge of fundamental combustion theory, engine controls and experience of developing combustion engines.  

  

**About Client**  

Marine/Industrial Development and Calibration within product development is responsible for testing and optimization of both hardware and software regarding performance, emissions and durability of all client´s industrial combustion engines.

  

As a **Development Engineer,** you will be accountable for delivering test and optimization tasks. You will be a part of a project team within the Marine/Industrial Development and Calibration teams. The work is mainly conducted in our test facilities but sometimes travels are needed to support customers or projects at other locations.

**Main tasks and responsibilities**


In this role, you will work with various tasks within engine testing; test-object preparation, performance testing or advanced software calibration of engine and aftertreatment systems. You need abilities to understand control systems by reading functional descriptions and using tools such as AVL Concerto, ATI Vision, Python and internal development tools.  

  

Collaboration is essential in this position, as you will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of engine systems while providing technical support, and expertise throughout the product development lifecycle. Additionally, you will prepare detailed reports on engine performance findings, calibration adjustments, and validation results, presenting your findings to stakeholders and contributing to continuous improvement initiatives.

 **Requirements**  

* Master of Science or similar relevant technical experience
* Several years of experience in combustion engine development
* Extensive engine calibration experience
* Fluent in English, written and spoken
* Driver's license for car
 **What we can offer**  

* A supportive team atmosphere that encourages open communication and collaboration.
* Opportunities for personal, and professional growth through shared learning experiences.
* A chance to contribute to exciting projects and make a real impact.
**Duration**: 2026-01-07 to 2026-12-31

**Location**: Göteborg

**Application Deadline:** 2025-12-15

**Offer continuously:** Please note that for this role we offer continuously. That means that we sometimes remove the assignments before the deadline. If you are interested, we recommend that you apply immediately.

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
**Empowering careers at ARJO****At Arjo, we know what moves us. We go above and beyond for people facing mobility challenges. We take every opportunity to work and grow as one team and take pride in sharing our knowledge and experience. Does that sound like something that moves you too?**  


**This could be your opportunity to begin a challenging and rewarding career in a healthcare company that empowers movement for people with mobility challenges.** **Position**: Mechanical Engineer, Product Development & Engineering
**Location**: Malmö, Sweden
**Job type:** Full Time, Permanent  


**The impact you will have**

We are looking for a Mechanical Engineer to join our collaborative and highly skilled Product Development & Engineering team in Malmö. In this role you will be key in developing and maintaining state-of-the-art medical devices that make a real difference for people facing mobility challenges. You will be involved in the design and development of mechanical systems and components, all the way from initial concept to running production, utilizing our advanced prototype workshop and rapid prototyping facilities, in a global and cross-functional setting.  


**Some of your responsibilities will be to:**
* Design and develop mechanical systems and components and prepare technical documentation, including specifications, part drawings, and assembly drawings.
* Create 3D models and perform analysis, including tolerance analysis and FEM simulations.
* Conduct customer visits and user tests to ensure our products meet real-user needs
* Develop and execute test procedures, including bench testing, to ensure design functionality and performance.
* Support the Design Assurance team to identify and mitigate design risks and perform verification and certification activities to ensure compliance with relevant standards and regulations (FDA, ISO, EU Medical Device Directives, etc.).
* Collaborate with sales units, manufacturing and suppliers to ensure cost efficient, high quality designs.
* Participate in root cause analysis and resolve design-related issues.
* Develop and maintain mechanical engineering procedures and tools.

  



To thrive in this role we think you combine technical expertise with curiosity and a strong problem-solving mindset. You are detail-oriented, enjoy working in dynamic and global environments, and bring a collaborative, analytical, and adaptable approach. Your passion for innovation and improving quality of life for users makes you a great fit for our team.  


**The skills you will need:**
* Minimum Bachelor´s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or similar engineering discipline.
* At least 3 years of experience in mechanical design.
* Proficiency in CAD software (SolidWorks preferred).
* Good understanding of cost control, DFM/DFA and product risk management.
* Understanding of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T).
* Experience with rapid prototyping and 3D printing technologies.
* Familiarity with machine shop practices and hands-on prototype development.
* Strong communication skills, to technical and non-technical audiences and ability to work effectively in global cross-functional teams.

  



Bringing experience in the medical device industry and knowledge of its standards and regulations will give you a strong advantage. Experience in other regulated industries is also appreciated. We’re especially interested in candidates with expertise or hands-on experience in areas such as plastic injection molding, composite technology, welded constructions, and fluid dynamics or plumbing.  



The role will require international travel.  



You will be reporting to the Manager Mechanical & Product Design, Malmö  


**What we will offer in return**At Arjo, you’ll work on products that truly make a difference in patients’ lives while growing your career in a fast-paced, mission-driven environment. You’ll learn from experienced engineers and quality professionals, supported by our Guiding Principles that foster a customer-focused, winning and sustainable culture. We value our globally connected employees and offer full support, training and opportunities for professional development as you help us drive healthier outcomes for people facing mobility challenges.  


**Why diversity matters to us**At Arjo, we believe in the power of diversity. We strongly encourage applicants from all parts of society, which means building a more diverse, equitable, inclusive and engaging environment – not only in the workplace, but also within the communities that we serve, work in and live in. We achieve this through a culture and mindset that values the uniqueness of all our people.  


**Contact**

If you have any inquiries about the position please contact Hiring Manager hanna.risen@arjo.com.  



Last day to submit your application is on 2026-01-07.  


**We look forward to your application!**  


**About Arjo**
**At Arjo, we believe that empowering movement within healthcare environments is essential to quality care. Our products and solutions are designed to promote a safe and dignified experience through patient handling, medical beds, personal hygiene, disinfection, diagnostics, and the prevention of pressure injuries and venous thromboembolism. With over 6500 people worldwide and 65 years caring for patients and healthcare professionals, we are committed to driving healthier outcomes for people facing mobility challenges.**  


**For more information about Arjo visit** **www.arjo.com**

title: Mechatronics Engineer
description:
Professional Galaxy is an IT and technology consulting company that provides highly specialized expertise in IT, software development, SAP, purchasing, electronics and mechanical design. We collaborate with experienced senior experts and deliver strategic value-creating expertise to some of Sweden's most complex and analytically demanding projects. Our focus is always on high quality, professionalism and clear, measurable results.

Feel free to apply today, selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis.


Professional Galaxy is looking for a **Mechatronics Engineer** on behalf of our client


We need to strengthen our Oil and Cooling system team with an experienced mechatronic hardware developer.

 **Required** **Skills :**  

* You have a M.Sc. within Product Development or similar.
* You have experience from development of fluid components such as pumps, valves or other relevant components giving you a good level of understanding component features. This includes understanding of fluid systems and requirements, component testing, technical documentation as well as technical negotiations with suppliers.
* You have experience from development of mechatronic parts with SMART actuators including technical requirements and verification and validation of SW.
* You have worked with supplier developed components and with SOW (statement of work).
* Basic knowledge in Creo is an advantage.
**The main tasks are:**

* Together with the team you will develop oil and cooling system components. This role include development tasks from early stage to maintenance. We are product owner meaning that we have big responsibility of our parts and to align with our colleagues in other functions such as purchasing, customer quality, and operations.
* We believe that you are a person with a curious mindset, self-driven with a can-do attitude. In your previous employments you have developed analytical skills and learnt the importance of developing new technical products in a structured and organized way. Former positions have given you a good level of understanding component features. You pay attention to details and can take necessary actions when required.
* The Oil and Cooling system group is part of the Base Engine department based in Gothenburg. The group has global design and system responsibility for oil and cooling functions within heavy duty combustion engines. This includes several components within the fluid segment. We cooperate with purchasing, projects, test engineers and suppliers as well as our colleagues at the sites in France, USA, and Brazil. Our products are used in more than 190 markets and considered to be part of the core business.

**Experience from mechatronics is needed for this position. Please read the profile description. Experience level can be lower, if profile demands are fulfilled.**
